data.title: Is it an Anagram?
data.statement:
For each string, work out if it's an anagram of the first string.

An anagram is a word or phrase that is formed by rearranging the letters of another word or phrase, usually using all the original letters exactly once. For example, the word anagram can be rearranged into nag a ram, or the word binary into brainy or the word adobe into abode. Anagrams are often used as a form of word play or as a literary device to create humor, irony, or hidden meanings.

testCases.title: Multiple words
testCases.testIn:
5
apple
banana
leapp
ppale
cat
dog
testCases.testOut:
not an anagram
anagram
anagram
not an anagram
not an anagram

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
5
pales
leaped
pleased
lapse
please
plead
testCases.testOut:
not an anagram
not an anagram
anagram
not an anagram
not an anagram

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
read o:word(100)
loop n read s:word(100)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] for the number of strings
<<Line 2:>> A string [[o]]the original string (containing only letters {{a}}-{{z}} )
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> A string [[s]] to compare with the original string (containing only letters {{a}}-{{z}} )

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

For each string, work out if it's an anagram of the first string.

An anagram is a word or phrase that is formed by rearranging the letters of another word or phrase, usually using all the original letters exactly once. For example, the word anagram can be rearranged into nag a ram, or the word binary into brainy or the word adobe into abode. Anagrams are often used as a form of word play or as a literary device to create humor, irony, or hidden meanings.
Input
Line 1: An integer n for the number of strings
Line 2: A string othe original string (containing only letters a-z )
Next n lines: A string s to compare with the original string (containing only letters a-z )
Output
n lines: either anagram or not an anagram
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 10
Example
Input
1
anagram
nagaram
Output
anagram
